decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall begin not later than three years from the date of this decision.  

Reason: In order to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990, as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and specifications:  4059-3 (Rev v1), Green Roofs Direct - Lightweight System Specification Received:  27 November 2024,  TQRQM24190162003680, TQRQM24190162506668 Received:  09 July 2024.  

Reason: In order to ensure the development is carried out in accordance with the planning permission.

Condition : 3 - The materials to be used in the construction of the single storey outbuilding hereby permitted shall be Thermowood (ultra-heated treated timber) cladding, fibre cement boarding, flat sedum green roofing and a dark grey UPVC framed window and glazed doors only.  

Reasons:  In order to protect the character and appearance of the site in accordance with Local Plan Policies SC7 (Residential extensions and alterations), CC1 (Context and character) and CC2 (Urban design and architecture) and the Residential Extension Guidelines.

Condition : 4 - No additional windows, doors or other glazed openings shall be formed in the single storey outbuilding hereby approved.  

Reasons:  In order to protect the character and appearance of the site in accordance with Local Plan Policies SC7 (Residential extensions and alterations), CC1 (Context and character) and CC2 (Urban design and architecture) and the Residential Extension Guidelines.

Condition : 5 - The detached single storey outbuilding hereby permitted shall only be used for a purpose incidental to the enjoyment of the house at No. 10 Osier Mews, W4 2NT described at the top of this decision notice and for no other purpose (for example, it may not be used as a self-contained dwelling or contain a bedroom, bathroom, kitchen or other primary residential accommodation, nor may it be used for business purposes).   

Reasons:  In order to protect neighbour living conditions and the character of the area in accordance with Local Plan Policy SC7 (Residential extensions and alterations), CC1 (Context and character) and CC2 (Urban design and architecture) and the Residential Extensions Guidelines.
description: Erection of a single storey outbuilding in the ground floor flat's rear garden.
